channel.title: Weed
channel.description:
I'm sure there already is a topic on this, but what ever.
What are your thoughts on "weed". Do you smoke it? Have you tried it before? Do you enjoy smoking it? Have you ever got caught smoking it by a family member? etc.
/Discuss.

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @Xx_Weed_Xx Xx Weed Xx
item.description:
@Xx_Weed_Xx wrote:

it reduces the ability of cancer cells to spread and shrinks tumors by at least 50%. its also good at relieving any kind of pain like from Multiple sclerosis…its also good at treating glaucoma and sometimes even stops the progression of it. it relieves nausea, stress, anxiety, headaches, migraines, arthritis, depression, Persistent muscle spasm, Spasticity, and anorexia(marijuana also stimulates appetite) which means ppl with Aids(wasting syndrome) also benefit from it and its also a good treatment for insomnia or if you have any kind of trouble sleeping…
some ppl are even using it to treat their ADD, ADHD, and bipolar disorder

marijuana can also prevent you from getting Alzheimer’s…
“THC, can prevent an enzyme called acetylcholinesterase from accelerating the formation of “Alzheimer plaques” in the brain more effectively than commercially marketed drugs”

“Studies even show that due to marijuana’s ability to clear the lungs of smog, pollutants, and cigarette smoke, it may actually reduce your risk of emphysema, bronchitis, and lung cancer. Smokers of cannabis have been shown to outlive non-smokers in some areas by up to two years. Medium to heavy tobacco smokers will live seven to ten years longer if they also smoke marijuana”

Read full topic

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:81, topic:398793”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=495930.msg3627031#msg3627031 date=1307912185]
Weed doesn’t affect me. My cousins smoke near daily, and I smoke with them. On 4/20, I try my hardest to get any feeling whatsoever. This last time, I smoked 4 bowls, and 3 blunts myself. After the first 2 bowls, everyone was faded. I kept going just to see if I have a high tolerance, but I still didn’t feel any different.
[/quote]Come over to where I live(even though your in washington lol)I’ll get you hooked up with a fatty it will kick you.[/quote]

Your probably not smoking it properly… Puff and then inhale air and hold it in as long as you can… Thats what gets you fucked up…

[quote=“Frell, post:95, topic:398793”][quote author=orcashark link=topic=495930.msg3628458#msg3628458 date=1308013116]
Yes i smoke it, i do enjoy smoking it, and my family doesnt care if i do…

Theres nothing wrong with weed, 100% of the weed “overdoses” We hear about are all weed that is laced.

Its impossible to overdose on bare marijuana and die, the worst that happens is you pass out and get hungry.
[/quote]
Actually the amount of THC in 15,000 pounds of weed can kill a human. But obviously you can see that this is merely a raw statistic without any variables.[/quote]

You would have to smoke over 20,000 joints in less then 20 minutes to die from weed… Which is inhuman.

Also in every 1500 joints you smoke you get the toxian’s in 1 cigarette… Or is is 15,000?

Read full topic

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Frell:

If its legalized ill probably do it again every now and then, but alone while I do graphics and not playing UNO lol.

I’m kind of the same way, id rather get high alone, and then spend my time learning (space, or anything) on the computer. And I try to limit it to before bed time only, so that I’m not a lazy burn-out during the day or around people.

My dad drinks tea at night to relax and read his newspapers. I like to smoke some weed and chill on the computer. Same deal exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“Xx Weed Xx, post:89, topic:398793”][quote author=xryz link=topic=495930.msg3627690#msg3627690 date=1307973116]
i dont have a problem with it. i havent smoked it, but if i get the chance to i will try it. the only problem i would have is if i smoked it and had to take a drug test to get a job… may end up trying it out soon, thought i was friday night but didnt get to.
[/quote]

Boy, you don’t have to do a drug’s to get a job.[/quote]

thats not what i said. i was saying if i smoked pot, then when i had to take a drug test the job i was applying for, i would fail since i smoked pot, therefore i wouldn’t get the job.

Read full topic

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:86, topic:398793”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=495930.msg3627472#msg3627472 date=1307940690]
From my last posts on weed, I’m not saying I don’t like it, I just don’t have the time for it. I beleive that it should be legal from all the research that proves it less harmful then alcohol. Ever see a high person go home and beat his wife and kids? No? Exactly. The worst you will do is try to eat your couch cause you think its a huge marshmallow.
[/quote]
The reason its not legal is because it would cost more money to regulate than they would generate in taxes, its easy for weed to be tainted with cocain and other drugs in order to get you hooked.[/quote]
Thats all fine and everything but its not the whole picture, the plant has tons of other uses that would far out way the negatives and could also solve our dependency on foreign oil. Bio diesel made from the plant (other then the bud) gives out the same amount of oxygen when growing as carbon dioxide it releases when burning (equal levels don’t cause the green house effect). Along the thousands of other things it can be used for it makes very cheep paper which would save millions if not billions of trees each year which would help reverse the green house effect also.

Read full topic

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:76, topic:398793”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=495930.msg3626256#msg3626256 date=1307846438]

I dont need weed to make myself feel good. It’s for my own recreation, like the internet or tv.

You can still smoke pot and become a doctor, a lawyer, a scientist for nasa. mathmetician, whatever. Smoking it so much is not very good for me, but it’s the least of my concerns. Other choices you make have a greater impact, such as diet

As always I’m not trying to get anyone to start, nor am I trying to convince anyone that its harmless. I’d just like to say its 2011 now lets loosen up and be more realistic about it.

Name one person who smokes weed and is doing something with their life.
[/quote]
You need to realize this right now:
There’s a lot of people doing nothing with their life that smoke weed all day. Do they do nothing with their life because of the weed? Or do they smoke weed, since they are already doing nothing with their life. It’s the latter.[/quote]

you can’t make generalizations such as that, as i’m quite positive numerous users are doing nothing with their life because of the substance itself. i do agree, however, that many others are smoking because they are already doing nothing with their life.

@topic:
i don’t smoke weed as i’ve stated before, but it’s puerile to argue whether weed is harmful or not to one’s well-being, especially here, so don’t argue if you don’t have any prior and/or sufficient knowledge. (not targeting one specific member)

Read full topic

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:51, topic:398793”][quote author=jme link=topic=495930.msg3626220#msg3626220 date=1307843984]
I dont need weed to make myself feel good. It’s for my own recreation, like the internet or tv.

You can still smoke pot and become a doctor, a lawyer, a scientist for nasa. mathmetician, whatever. Smoking it so much is not very good for me, but it’s the least of my concerns. Other choices you make have a greater impact, such as diet

As always I’m not trying to get anyone to start, nor am I trying to convince anyone that its harmless. I’d just like to say its 2011 now lets loosen up and be more realistic about it.
[/quote]

Name one person who smokes weed and is doing something with their life.[/quote]

Hmm lets see, most likely your parents. Myself? I’m 20 years old and I already have a good career and I’m set for life.

You need to realize this right now:
There’s a lot of people doing nothing with their life that smoke weed all day. Do they do nothing with their life because of the weed? Or do they smoke weed, since they are already doing nothing with their life. It’s the latter.

There is nothing prohibiting you from smoking weed and doing something with your life. It’s total ignorance to think otherwise.

Read full topic

item.title: Weed
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:74, topic:398793”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=495930.msg3626672#msg3626672 date=1307885048]
Xtenindustries was his first one but he has partner contracts also with a few of Monarch Plastics factories (he often has more workers on payroll then can work in the main buildings so they work at partner company’s for the same payroll).
[/quote]Go get us pictures some time, cause I still find it hard to believe.

Also on the teacher note, they make more then the normal American :/[/quote]Not always true, it depends on if it is a private/public school, the grade, the degree level, the experience, the location, the population, the expected amount of work, the type of class that would be taught, the actual need for a teacher, what type of organization the school/daycare is, if the school is funded via the State, etc.

Generally, church teachers(those who have like preschools or something barely make shit. Even as the director of one you dont make a lot.

Read full topic
